籤詩版本二:
A book about one plan and one use
Don’t dare to act after thinking before thinking
It’s time for noble people to help
Like a gable, you can live in peace
詩意: This hexagram house is like a wall. Everything is safe and without danger.
解曰: Make something new out of something old. Cold flowers meet spring. Previously blocked. Now I am satisfied.
籤詩故事一:
◇Liu Ji admonished the Lord
In the Ming Dynasty, Liu Ji, whose courtesy name was Bowen and posthumous title Wencheng, was born in Qingtian (now Wencheng County), Zhejiang.
He is well-read in the classics and history, and is good at writing poems and articles. He was also proficient in astronomy and military art and helped Zhu Yuanzhang unify the world.
At that time, Zhu Yuanzhang selected and led his soldiers to Anfeng, hoping to relieve the besieged Anfeng City.
Liu Ji came to dissuade him in a hurry, judging that he would be defeated if he went there. As Liu Ji expected, Zhu Yuanzhang was trapped.
Generals Xu Da and Chang Yuchun came to rescue him, and Zhu Yuanzhang was able to escape.
聖意:
The house is safe.
Good luck to itself.
Seeking wealth Yes.
Trading is difficult.
Marriage is hindered.
Liujia Female.
Pedestrian: Late.
Field silkworms are ripe.


Six animals benefit.
It’s too late to find someone.
Public litigation should be peaceful.
Migration is lucky.
Lost property without a trace.
Disease Yan'an.
Mountain tomb: It is good to keep things as they are.
